lines.text: You just killed a transmigrating soul. I mean that could have been Beethoven, Boticelli... Jack Benny.
Are you trying to get me to fall in love with the dog... and then with you?

[struggling to get into a dress]
Argh! I feel like I'm caught in a Trojan! A pleated Trojan! With fringe!
You clean? This is cleaning, right? My son is cleaning? I never thought I'd live to see the day... actually I didn't.
Slim pickings this afternoon. They're married, or they dribble, or they're *otherwise engaged*.
Will you lighten up? You didn't marry Hastings for his money!
Of course I did! What else do you get married for? Love? Love lasts six, eight months tops. Money is forever.
You should never help a human being who makes his living suctioning thigh fat.
He's a brilliant Doctor, and so creative!
So, it's a not a sonnet.
